intro: Nematoceras dienemum, commonly known as the yellow-eyed grass, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in dense clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Nematoceras dienemum is often found in wet or marshy habitats, thriving in moist soils. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
